name: Johannes Peter Wallner
content: Johannes P. Wallner Johannes Peter Wallner Address Graz University of Technology Faculty of Computer Science and Biomedical Engineering Institute of Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence Inffeldgasse 16b/II 8010 Graz, Austria Mail TU Graz online personal entry Page@institute personal page Group page KRR A reminder "The choices and actions implemented in this decade will have impacts now and for thousands of years (high confidence)." IPCC, 2023: Summary for Policymakers. In: Climate Change 2023: Synthesis Report. Core Writing Team, H. Lee and J. Romero (eds.). Contents About me Research Interests Professional Activities Teaching Software Publications Competitions About me I am an associate professor at Graz University of Technology (TU Graz). I work in the Institute of Software Engineering and Artificial lntelligence, Faculty of Computer Science and Biomedical Engineering. I am leading the group specialized in Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KRR). Previously, I was a researcher in the DBAI group of the Institute of Logic and Computation, TU Wien and a member of the Constraint Reasoning and Optimization group at the University of Helsinki, Computer Science Department. Before working at universities, I had several internships at Siemens PSE, working with software testing and configuration management tools. More details can be found in my CV http://orcid.org/0000-0002-3051-1966 Awards and Recognitions Early Career Track at IJCAI 2024 (by invitation only; 12 selected researchers globally) "Top Scholar" according to ScholarGPS in 2024 (top 0.5 % worldwide in Artifical Intelligence). "AI 2000 Most Influential Scholar Honorable Mention in Knowledge Engineering" by AMiner in 2021 and 2022 (top 11-100 scholars in the domain). Runner-Up Best Student Paper Award at ECAI 2016 Distinguished student paper prize at KR 2012 Honorable mention from International Competition on Computational Models of Argumentation (ICCMA) 2015 for participating solver cegartix IJCAI 2019 Distinguished Program Committee member, "Discussion Master" award for ECAI 2023. Invited Talks and Funding Invited talk at Arg&App 2025 Invited as visiting professor to Université Toulouse Capitole in 2025 Invited talk at SAFA 2024 Invited talk at the Workshop on Recent Trends in Formal Argumentation Invited talk at the Oberseminar of the Artificial Intelligence Group at FernUnversität Hagen Project funding (PI): A Novel Computational Workflow for Argumentation in AI. Funded by Austrian Science Fund (FWF) under grant P 35632 (358.848 €). Project funding (PI): Extending Belief Change to Advance Dynamics in Argumentation. Funded by Austrian Science Fund (FWF) under grant P30168-N31 (353.438 €). Professional Activities Member of the program committee (PC) of, or reviewer for 2026: AAAI, ICLP, SAC, PADL 2025: AAAI, ICAPS, LICS, JELIA, ICLP, SAC (KRR track), ASPOCP, RCRA, IM, TKR, ArgXAI, 2024: AAAI, IJCAI, UAI, ECAI, LPNMR, COMMA, PADL, SAC (KRR track), ASPOCP, ArgXAI, SAFA, RCRA, 2023: AAAI, IJCAI, KR, ECAI, JELIA, SAC (KRR), ASPOCP, RCRA, ArgXAI, FCR, 2022: IJCAI, KR, UAI, COMMA, LPNMR, SAC (KRR track), RCRA, 2021: AAAI, IJCAI (senior PC), KR, UAI, SAC (KRR track), 2020: AAAI, IJCAI, KR, ECAI, SAC, COMMA, SAFA, STAIRS, ASPOCP, 2019: AAAI, IJCAI, AAMAS, LPNMR, SAC (KRR track), ASPOCP, RCRA, 2018: AAAI, IJCAI, KR, COMMA, SAFA, RCRA 2017: IJCAI, IEA/AIE (AppArg track), RCRA, TAFA, 2016: IJCAI (main track), COMMA, RCRA, SAFA, TAASP, 2015: IJCAI (KR track), and RCRA. Member of the Program Committee Board of IJCAI (2022-2024). Organization activities Co-Chair of the Doctoral Consortium at KR 2024. Member of the local arrangements committee of IJCAI 2022 (part of the workshop and tutorial coordinators). Co-organizer of the workshop on Recent Advances in Collaborative and Argumentative Decision-Making. Co-organizer of the fourth international workshop on systems and algorithms for formal argumentation (SAFA 2022). Co-organizer of the workshop on New Trends in Formal Argumentation 2017. Member of the editorial board of Argument and Computation. Member of the steering committee of ICCMA. Fifth place for solving JELIA'23 puzzle. Research Interests Knowledge representation and reasoning, artificial intelligence, argumentation, abduction, belief change, inconsistency handling and measurement, computational social choice, computational complexity, Boolean satisfiability, and answer set programming. Teaching For Bachelor's or Master's thesis, see topics. Logic-based Knowledge Representation (TU Graz) [ 2022 | 2023 | 2024 | 2025 ] Intelligent Systems (TU Graz) [ 2025 | 2026 ] Declarative Programming (TU Graz) [ 2026 ] Artificial Intelligence 2 (former Basics in AI and Logic) (TU Graz) [ 2021 | 2022 | 2023 | 2024 | 2025 | 2026 ] Foundations of Computer Science (TU Graz, FH Joanneum, FH Campus 02) [ 2022 | 2023 | 2024 ] Data Base Systems (TU Wien) [ 2020 ] Scientific Writing for MSc in Computer Science (University of Helsinki) [ 2016 ] Seminar on Computational Social Choice (University of Helsinki) [ 2016 ] Seminar on Tractability (University of Helsinki) [ 2015 ] Abstract Argumentation (TU Wien) [ 2012 | 2014 | 2017 | 2018 | 2019 ] Software I contributed to the (theory of the) following systems. CEGARTIX: a SAT-based argumentation system for argumentation frameworks Vispartix: a visualization of argumentation frameworks generated from knowledge bases (using the software ARVis) ADFsys: an ASP-based argumentation system for abstract dialectical frameworks SAT-based argumentation systems: software using SAT-extensions for argumentation frameworks QADF: QBF-based implementation of ADF semantics GERD: Genteel Extended argumentation Reasoning Device, an ASP-based system for computing extensions of EAFs Pakota: MaxSAT and IP based implementation for extension and status enforcement for abstract argumentation AbHS: A propositional abduction solver based on the implicit hitting set paradigm AFSynth: AF synthesis via MaxSAT aba2af: system for reasoning about acceptance in assumption-based argumentation via argumentation frameworks k++ADF: a SAT-based reasoner for abstract dialectical frameworks ASPARTIX: ASP-based system for reasoning in argumentation frameworks ASP for ABA: ASP-based system for reasoning tasks in assumption-based argumentation AcbAr: a solver for assumption-based argumentation instantiating optimized AFs ASTRA: a solver for reasoning in assumption-based argumentation based on tree-decompositions (requires D-FLAT) Publications and Presentations See also: [ Google Scholar | DBLP | profile@TU Graz ] 2026 [96] Under-Approximating Semantics in Clustered Assumption-Based Argumentation Iosif Apostolakis and Johannes P.
